snippet: The bank’s move is a reversal from previous optimism that the euro zone economy would start to recover next year.
abstract: European Central Bank, acknowledging that the economy is likely to remain weak well into 2013, sharply reduces its growth forecast for the euro zone and leaves its main interest rate unchanged at a record low of 0.75 percent; separately, Bank of England decides to hold its benchmark interest rate at 0.5 percent, also a record low.

byline.original: By MELISSA EDDY and JACK EWING
byline.contributor:
Melissa Eddy reported from
Frankfurt and Jack Ewing from
Warsaw. Julia Werdigier contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: The bank’s move is a reversal from previous optimism that the euro zone economy would start to recover next year.

headline.main: European Central Bank Cuts Growth Forecast
headline.print_headline: European Central Bank, Citing Uncertainty, Cuts Growth Forecast
